paper_abstract: Metallic carbon nanotubes (CNTs) pose a major barrier to the design of digital logic circuits using CNT field-effect transistors (CNFETs). Metallic CNTs create source to drain shorts in CNFETs, resulting in undesirable effects such as excessive leakage and degraded noise margins. No known CNT growth technique guarantees 0% metallic CNTs. Therefore, special processing techniques are required for removing metallic CNTs after CNT growth. This paper presents a probabilistic model which incorporates processing and design parameters and enables quantitative analysis of the impact of metallic CNTs on leakage, noise margin, and delay variations of CNFET-based digital logic circuits. With practical constraints on these key circuit performance metrics, the model provides design and processing guidelines that are required for very large scale integration (VLSI)-scale metallic-CNT-tolerant digital circuits.
paper_title: Probabilistic Analysis and Design of Metallic-Carbon-Nanotube-Tolerant Digital Logic Circuits
